instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00045 5.17v on PPDCIN_G3H
threads.message:
hello

i'm working on a 820-00045
the board looks pretty much ok
no liquid damage, doesn't seem like been tampered with before

but still, no power...
from reading around the board, i get this results..

On F4700 is 5.17v on both sides

PP3V3R3V0_AON is 3.3v

PP5V_S0 is 0v

PP3V3_S0 is 0.020v


i know that low voltage on PPDCIN_G3H is many times related to a short on PP3V3R3V0_AON caused by u4700
but in this case PP3V3R3V0_AON is present and resistance to ground is around 300 ohms.

any help would be appreciated..

thanks..

threads.title: 820-00045 5.17v on PPDCIN_G3H
threads.message: PPBUS present and LED next to battery connector lighting up? It could still be a half dead U4700

threads.title: 820-00045 5.17v on PPDCIN_G3H
threads.message:
hi duke

PPBUS_G3H is present (8.6v)

the little led is glowing when connected...

but still, no PP5V_S0 or PP3V3_S0
and obviously no cpu_vcore..

threads.title: 820-00045 5.17v on PPDCIN_G3H
threads.message: Start with U4700. I assume you have tried a known good USB-C port cable.

threads.title: 820-00045 5.17v on PPDCIN_G3H
threads.message:
hi

so after replacing u4700 i got all the rails..
ppdcin_g3h is 14.7v and got cpu vcore (1.7v)

after putting the board back to the machine i get no image on screen, no chime.. only feedback from the forcetouch trackpad when charger connecrted..
this is actually the machine from an older thread of mine, with a "new" board -
[url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/36673-820-00045-no-power[/url]

it's behaving the same as the original board of this machine, it gets cpu vcore but still dead...

also no response to smc reset \ pram reset...
on the oriignal board for this machine it was concluded as brain dead..
what are the odds that the second board intended for this machine was u4700 bad and than brain dead?
i'm a bit puzzled by this...

what else can cause this? bad keyboard\ trackpad ? bad screen? usb connector?
should this board chime with only one speaker connected when its OK?

thanks...

threads.title: 820-00045 5.17v on PPDCIN_G3H
threads.message: Audio jack board must be connected for it to chime. Get a USB-C to USB adapter and connect a mouse and see if it lights up.

threads.title: 820-00045 5.17v on PPDCIN_G3H
threads.message:
hi
ok will get a usb-c hub and check, because also need the charger to be connected..

the audio jack was connected, still no chime..

will update after checking with usb mouse..
